entry.title: Re: is the a transaction where I can get the value of mhd...
entry.content:
Instead of parsing the DESADV IDoc line-by-line, you can retrieve the MHDRZ (Shelf Life Expiration Date Rule) from the delivery document using standard transaction via VL03N. There, navigate to Item ‚Üí Batch ‚Üí Shelf Life Data Or Item ‚Üí Additional Data ‚Üí Expiration Date Rule (MHDRZ) if available. This shows the life rule applied at the time of delivery creation.

Having said that, when SAP sends a DESADV IDoc to a 3PL, it pulls data directly from the outbound delivery document. That means the MHDRZ value used in the IDoc is the same one stored in the delivery. You don‚Äôt need to parse the IDoc to find MHDRZ, you can just check the delivery document itself.

entry.title: Journaling for Resilience in the Corporate Context
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs fast-paced corporate world, stress, overwhelm, and even burnout can easily creep into our day-to-day lives. While organizations are increasingly investing in well-being initiatives, there is one simple, low-cost, and highly effective tool that is often overlooked: journaling.

Why Journaling?

Journaling is more than simply ‚Äúkeeping a diary.‚Äù It‚Äôs a structured way to pause, reflect, and create mental space. Research shows that regular expressive writing can:

  • Reduce stress and support emotional regulation
  • Strengthen resilience by helping us process challenges more constructively
  • Boost clarity, creativity, and problem-solving
  • Foster a sense of agency and self-awareness

In the context of burnout prevention, journaling acts as a buffer: instead of suppressing emotions or letting them spiral, we can capture them on paper and view them from a safer distance. This shift often reduces overwhelm and opens up new perspectives.

Journaling in the Workplace

At SAP, we are exploring how journaling can be integrated into our culture of well-being and resilience. Journaling sessions provide employees with a structured time-out from the noise of daily tasks‚Äîcreating room to reflect, reset, and recharge. They can be facilitated virtually or on-site and require nothing more than a pen and paper.

How to Structure a 30-Minute Journaling Session

A short, guided journaling session can already have a big impact. Here‚Äôs a simple structure you can use:

  1. Arrive (1 minute)
    A short moment to pause, close the eyes, and take a breath. This helps participants shift from ‚Äúdoing mode‚Äù into ‚Äúbeing mode.‚Äù
  2. Introduction (2 minutes)
    Briefly explain how journaling works and share the benefits. Emphasize that it‚Äôs not about writing beautifully or perfectly‚Äîit‚Äôs about honesty, curiosity, and self-reflection.
  3. Guided Prompts (15 minutes)
    Offer 3‚Äì4 journaling prompts. Give participants about 3 minutes per prompt to write freely, without overthinking. Invite mini breaks in between the prompts, such as taking three conscious breaths, looking around for a moment, or simply shaking your hands.
    Example prompts could be: ‚ÄúRight now, I feel‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚ÄúOne thing that is taking a lot of my energy is‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚ÄúA small step I could take to support myself this week is‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚ÄúWhat am I grateful for today?‚Äù
  4. Reflection (3 minutes)
    Invite participants to read through what they wrote. They don‚Äôt need to edit or judge, just notice what stands out.
  5. Optional Sharing (5‚Äì7 minutes)
    Create an open space where participants can (if they wish) share insights, discoveries, or surprises. Listening is just as valuable as sharing.

Why It Works

This simple practice helps employees reconnect with themselves, recognize stress patterns early, and uncover inner resources for resilience. Over time, journaling builds a habit of pausing and reflecting, which translates into greater well-being and better stress management.

A Gentle Invitation

If you‚Äôre curious, try journaling for yourself‚Äîor bring a short session into your team. All it takes is 30 minutes, a pen, and some openness. The benefits for clarity, resilience, and burnout prevention can be surprisingly profound.

Have you tried journaling at work‚Äîor would you be interested in joining a guided session? Share your thoughts in the comments.

Would you like me to also draft a set of ready-to-use journaling prompts tailored for corporate teams (e.g., resilience, teamwork, stress release)?

entry.title: Multiple asset transfer between company's branches/divisions
entry.content: Hi. Our team is implementing SAP ERP for a bank. The system is SAP S/4HANA 2023 om-premise. There are several branches and other divisions within the bank. When we want to do an asset transfer from one branch/division to another one (from one cost center to another one), we need a financial posting to be able to calculate spendings and to make a balance for each branch. Each branch is a separate profit center and a separate cost center, while divisions in Head Office have one profit center but separate cost centers. We found <Intracompany asset transfer> application to proceed with the transfer. Do I understand right, that in this case this is the best suitable application for registering asset movement? When we make a single asset transfer the sending asset is credited and the receiving asset is debited, but I can't find the underlying transactions: I understood that the sending asset should be credited, a clearing account of the appropriate cost center/profit center should be debited, then the clearing account should be credited and then the receiving asset should be debited. Am I wrong? Besides, could you please suggest if there is an opportunity to transfer asset to a new one in case of multiple asset transfer? Thank you in advance for your experienced answers and time spent.

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì Which notification to use when ‚Äì Workflow, Situation Handling, KPIs,
entry.content:
I did report the inconsistency @Jocelyn_Dart - and after a little back and forth due to misunderstandings the (final, I suppose) response from SAP Development Support is that they acknowledge the inconsistency but suggest that I make the group titles completely incomprehensible in order to be consistent with the texts used in the Fiori Launchpad notification settings.

In their own words: "You are right that it is difficult to recognize the relation between the grouped text and the workflow step name, which is used in the fiori launchpad settings for notifications. But until now we didn't get any further complaints about this from other customers and therefore development rated this request as 'nice to have' and decided to handle this only as a feature request. As workaround we recommend to adapt the grouped text to make the relation between grouped text and notification settings more clear. "

Naturally they set the status to "Customer Action" and will automatically confirm in 20 days. For once I think I will let it auto-confirm, because I will not be recorded as closing this ticket. 

In contrast the KDE Community does not take so lightly on closing unresolved bug reports and feature requests: bug fixed after 13 years and requested feature implemented after 22 years üôÇ

entry.title: Re: DM - Data Collection Field in POD Work List
entry.content:
Hi,

since data collections could be associated on workcenter, operations, orders, materials, i don't think it will be easy to integrate directly on worklist plugin. Because worklist plugin contain information regarding workcenter+operation+sfc...

I suggest you two way::

  1. you can try to propose your new idea on SAP Influce portal hoping that other users need the same --> here
  2. in the meantime (from proposal to real implementation could took years...) i suggest you to create an extension of SAP DM Custom Core plugins (the worklistplugin) inside SAP BTP and add a column with what you need.

For choice two you can refeer on Github repository --> here
Build custom plugin (Saint Kevin Hunter :-D) --> here

You have to extend standard core plugin, you can:
- read documentation --> here
- follow Manoel's Costa guide --> here 

I suggest you to use the build custom plugin guide (it's more recent) and apply Manoel's guide to build your first custom core plugin extensions!

Please feel free to answer if you need support!

entry.title: Re: Implementing Push Notifications
entry.content:
I had the same issue and i solved with some research:

  1. try if the custom "MEASUREMENT" it works, if with this is joining inside the notification
  2. search if you have deployed other standard core plugins that are posting custom notifications, if yes, remove from the other plugins OR search the one that is correctly answering on the "MEASUREMENT" notification

I have isolated the plugin and then it is working fine.

entry.title: Re: Managing Agricultural WIP Using WBS and Project Stock...
entry.content:
1.  Don't use Movement Type 201, this is a GI to a Cost Center.  Use 221 which is GI to a WBS or 221Q if you are using WBS Project Stock.

2.  When you post costs from a material consumption to a WBS it is on a P&L expense account then you need to use RA to move the costs from the P&L to the Balance Sheet (WIP).  This is standard SAP behavior.

3. What RA method are you using to move the costs to WIP?  It sounds like completion of Contract is applicable.

Have you looked at the difference between Valuated and Non-Valuated Project Stock?  This also comes into play for cost flow.

It is very common practice to use a PS Project with just WBS elements as a cost collector for many industries.

entry.title: Leave Encashment from Annual Leave Quota every year should not go beyond a Capping of 150 days
entry.content:
Namaste Everyone,

In this blog we shall understand a challenge we faced in Time Off - Leave Encashments and how did we arrive at a peculiar solution.

Problem Statement:

The number of days that can be accumulated for a particular Leave Encashment from Annual Leave Quota every year and should not go beyond a Capping of 150 days for the member's service period. This shall be paid to an employee at time of retirement only.

Problem Transformation in SAP/SF Consulting Terms:

An Employee is eligible to take days from Annual Leaves Quota as Leave Encashment every year. When we try to take Leave Encashment until Year 2029, it should allow us to save as Capping is 150.

However, when an employee tries to take Leave Encashment for Year 2030, it should error out and not let an employee save the record. Please refer to below screenshot: 

NOTE: We can take various variations of this encashment: 15 each year would take 10 years to reach capping of 150 days.

Challenges in Standard Approach:

  1. There is no Standard Fit to fetch the data stored in Time Account for Payouts to meet this requirement.
  2. Addition of Payouts from different years.
  3. Rule definition to cater to Payouts from different years.

Solution Proposed:

Leave Encashments leave a trail of Pay Component attached for Leave Encashments within the Compensation ‚Äì Non-Recurring Portlet. We trickled down this Portlet to:

1.Fetch the number of days of Leave Encashment in a particular year.

2.Pass them on to a field ‚ÄúPlaceholder‚Äù in a Custom MDF (Encashment) for that year via an Integration Job.

3.From ‚ÄúPlaceholder‚Äù, it is cumulated via business rule to fill Cumulative Capping in a field ‚ÄúCumulated Capping‚Äù. 

‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

‚îÇ Employee applies Leave

‚îÇ Encashment ‚îÇ

‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò

                ‚îÇ

                ‚ñº

‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

‚îÇ Pay Component created in

‚îÇ Compensation ‚Äì Non-Recurring

‚îÇ Portlet ‚îÇ

‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò

                ‚îÇ

                ‚ñº

‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò

‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò

‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò

Technical Build: 

1. Let us check the Leave Encashment page and try to place Payouts.

 

 

 

2. This should create a Payout linked Pay Component in Non-Recurring Portlet. Let us check that out:

As we can see the Leave Encashment days ‚Äì 30 are captured here in ‚ÄúNumber‚Äù field of Pay Component ‚Äì DEMO_PC_LEAVEENCASH

3. We create an Integration Centre job that shall carry the required data from Non-Recurring Pay Components Portlet to fields in Custom MDF (Annual Encashment)

4. After running IC job, we can see field ‚ÄúPlaceholder‚Äù carries 30.

Pay Component field carries: DEMO_PC_LEAVEENCASH (as we want values associated only to this Pay Component to be sent to this MDF) 

 

5. But what about field- Cumulated Capping?

We shall create another business rule to carry the ‚ÄúPlaceholder‚Äù values to ‚ÄúCumulated Capping.‚Äù It will function as a Summation counter adding previous and present values.

6. We shall continue to fill in 30 days till 2029. In Year, 2030- this should give us an error on taking any Leave Encashment days as then it would be greater than capping i.e., 150 days.

 

7. Let us check that in our instance:

We have taken Leave Encashments from YEAR 2025 till 2029. Cumulative Capping thus becomes 150.So, it should error out on YEAR 2030.

ERROR RULE:

Some checks for the YEARs of encashments taken: 

We will run IC job in the backend for every year of Leave Encashment filled. 

As such, MDF also has field- Cumulated Capping = 150.

8. We shall create Payout Request now:

When we try to Submit this record, an error comes. 

In the manner above, we were able to provide solution to this challenging problem by use of Integration Centre and a lot of Consulting expertise.

Hope you find it helpful!

entry.title: Re: MRP not considering batch length Correctly
entry.content:
The core issue is that MRP in S/4HANA Public Cloud calculates stock in aggregate units (meters) and does not evaluate batch-level characteristics like individual tube length during planning. So even if you need a 4m tube, MRP sees 2 tubes of 2m as ‚Äú4m available‚Äù, which leads to incorrect planning.

To make MRP behave correctly, you need to guide it to plan based on usable tube pieces, not just total meters. Here's how you can do that: (This is just my thought process and not sure whether it will work)

  • Create a phantom material Z_TUBE_4M that represents a single usable tube of 4 meters. Set its base unit of measure to PC. This phantom material is not stocked, it‚Äôs just a planning purpose only.
  • Replace the raw tube (in meters) with the phantom material Z_TUBE_4M in the BOM of your finished product with quantity as 1 pc per finished material. This tells MRP: ‚ÄúI need one usable tube of 4m length per finished product.‚Äù
  • Create a phantom BOM for Z_TUBE_4M that includes the actual raw tube material like TUBE_M in meters. This BOM should reflect that 1 PC of Z_TUBE_4M = 4 meters of TUBE_M.
  • Now MRP will Plan for 1 PC of Z_TUBE_4M Which translates to 4 meters of actual tube material, but only if a batch exists with ‚â• 4m length.
  • For TUBE_M, activate the Batch Management. Define a batch characteristic like CHAR_LENGTH. Assign it to a batch class and link it to the material. Maintain actual length in each batch during GR.
  • The next step would be assign a selection class with rule in the production order or BOM. This ensures only batches with sufficient length are selected during production. Please note, this affects batch determination during production, not MRP itself.
  • Finally, run MRP and check that it generates PR for the actual raw material (TUBE_M) based on the phantom demand. If no batch with ‚â• 4m exists, production will fail to confirm ‚Äî and planners will know to procure new stock.

entry.title: Re: ps project closing
entry.content:
Settlement within a project the costs are staying on the P&L so no Financial postings occur only Controlling postings.  When settling form the WBS to the AuC you are moving costs from the P&L to the Balance sheet so you are making a Financial Posting.  FI postings cannot use Secondary Cost elements they need Primary Cost elements.

Since the NWA settled to the WBS on a Secondary CE that CE cannot be used to move from the WBS to the AuC. 

You need to configure the Allocation Structure used on the WBS to settle with a correct CE.

entry.title: Re: redirect to order information page when user click on...
entry.content:
Hi Ankit,
officially internal ID is never shown inside SAP DM.

But there is not reccomend way to call an internal API that as i told you i would not reccomend. 
Why? They are not public, and you can not control the changes on that during software release, and also there is no documentation.

Anyway, i just discovered that the call to get order information is a REST API that look like:https://xxxxxxy.web.dmc.cloud.sap/sapdmdmemanageorder/~XXXXXXe~/dme/demand-ms/shopOrders/moaOrders?size=20&page=0&freeSearch=PUTYOURODER&releaseStatuses=NOT_RELEASABLE,HOLD,RELEASED,PARTIALLY_RELEASED,RELEASABLE&sort=modifiedDateTime,desc

the anwser is a json where you can find also the id., just for testing purpose :-).


And again for testing purpose you can get the demand uri and re-create the call just by hitting this:
this.getPodController().getDemandRestDataSourceUri() + "shopOrders/moaOrders?size=20&page=0&freeSearch=PUTYOURODER"

I'm not suggesting you to use this way, but for testing purpose you can try and let me know if it works on dev env!

entry.title: SAP Ariba and SAP Fieldglass road maps are updated and combinable in SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
If you follow the blog posts the SAP Activate team does, you will see that our road maps are never still, they are always evolving and adapting to better assist our customers in their implementation journey. No matter if you are implementing a single SAP solution or several ones from an SAP Business Suite package, we want to support you and guide you in the best way we can.

With that in mind, the SAP Ariba and SAP Fieldglass experts and I spent several weeks reviewing the both road maps, their deliverables, tasks and accelerators to be able to provide you with the most recent and accurate information. We did almost 300 updates, that goes from removing/adding accelerators; updating steps in the task‚Äôs Procedure; reorganizing the position of some deliverables/tasks; replacing tasks for others that are more detailed; to adding new information. You can find a list of the most impactful updates below or check the complete list in the SAP Ariba release notes and SAP Fieldglass release notes.

SAP Ariba

  • Updated Supplier Enablement deliverables and tasks with new instructions and accelerators.
  • Updated the Description and Procedure in the tasks:
    • Create Test Strategy
    • Determine the Required Master and Transaction Data
    • Determine Rollout Plan
    • Perform Main Configuration
    • Execute Test Cases
    • Defect Management
    • Document Configuration Values
    • Determine the Required Master and Transaction Data
  • Added accelerators in the tasks:
    • Start Your Onboarding Journey
    • Manage Project Issues, Risks, and Changes
    • Identify Integration Prerequisites
    • Plan and Design User Permissions for SAP Ariba
    • Collect Details for Extensions for SAP Ariba

SAP Fieldglass

  • Added the task Self-Enable on SAP Fieldglass
  • Updated the accelerators in the tasks:
    • Review Overview Documentation
    • Prepare for Fit-to-Standard Workshops for SAP Fieldglass
    • Self-Enable on the Fit-to-Standard Process
    • Create Project Schedule and Budget
    • Create Project Charter and Scope Statement
    • Configure SAP Fieldglass
  • Updated the Description and Procedure in the tasks:
    • Perform Data Cleansing Activities
    • Document Delta Requirement
    • Execute Data Migration for Fieldglass
    • Create Cutover Plan and Documentation
    • Document Integration Specifications
    • Define Project Communications and Reporting

Common updates

  • Added the deliverable Introduction to SAP Business Suite and tasks Review the SAP Business Suite Offering and Try SAP to help the customer familiarize with the SAP Business Suite offerings and experience.
  • Added the task Handover Project from Sales to Delivery Team under the deliverable Project Initiation and Governance in the Prepare phase, instead of having it in the Discover phase.
  • Updated the Description and Procedure in the Project Quality Gate tasks.
  • Added a new Project Plan (WBS) to the roadmaps.
  • Updated the Deliverables by Workstreams Graphic in the Overview page.
    • SAP Ariba
    • SAP Fieldglass

That is not all though: we are happy to announce that from now one SAP Ariba roadmap and SAP Fieldglass roadmap are combinable in SAP Cloud ALM! It means that whenever you are creating a project in that tool, you can combine multiple roadmaps ‚Äì including those two, if applicable ‚Äì into one comprehensive project. Using this feature, you will be able to organize your implementation project in a way you will have one project management structure, see only once the activities that need to be executed across products and still have the list of the product-specific configuration you need to execute. This will help you in better manage your tasks and your time, as well as having a holistic view of the project.

Do you want to know more about how to use the combinable feature in SAP Cloud ALM? Check the Cross-solution SAP Activate Road Maps with Cloud ALM blog post and the Combining Activate Roadmaps in SAP Cloud ALM video that @dcko made for you!

Thank you @gcarmos, John Daykton, Madhav Tadikonda and Logan CoBell for the help and partnership in doing these reviews and updates!

entry.title: Put your thinking cap on! It‚Äôs time to make some tough choices‚Ä¶
entry.content:
Ok friends, it‚Äôs the moment you‚Äôve been waiting for. The SAP TechEd agenda builder is now LIVE. Do you know what that means?! It means that you can now create your own personalized agenda for our 3-day extravaganza ‚Äì including booking the highly-coveted Hands-On Workshops in Berlin! (Trust me ‚Äì they‚Äôre a kind of a big deal!)

Remember: you need a Full Conference Pass to book Hands-On Workshops and there is a maximum of 2 allowed per attendee. Act now and book your favorites! They fill up FAST!

Building your agenda is really quite simple‚Ä¶

Just find the session you want to attend, choose Add to Schedule and that's it!

The hard part will be deciding which sessions are ‚Äúthe ones‚Äù that earn precious time during your TechEd event experience.

Let‚Äôs do a quick recap of exactly what‚Äôs available in Berlin:

Strategy Talks: 25‚Äô overview of main strategic initiatives that any SAP enthusiast needs to know. These sessions include insights from SAP leaders and often feature customers and partners who share their experiences and outlook towards innovation and transformation.

My pick: ST116 | SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools

Road Maps: Any good developer knows that they need to stay up on the latest and greatest innovations in order to do their job well. Join these 25‚Äô sessions to learn what has been recently delivered by SAP and what‚Äôs planned for the next several quarters.

My pick: AI822 | Road map: What‚Äôs planned for Joule

Deep Dives: 45‚Äô lecture-style sessions designed to broaden your knowledge and give you concrete, tangible insights you can take back to your SAP development and implementation projects.

My pick: IN100 | Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite

Hands-On Workshops: ‚ÄúLearn by doing‚Äù in these guided 2-hour, exercise-based sessions where our SAP experts have created the perfect ‚Äúenvironment‚Äù for you to explore, learn and enhance your skills.

My pick: AD164 | Get started with ABAP Cloud for classic ABAP developers

Community Talks: Tired of listening to SAP talk about SAP? Don‚Äôt worry, it happens to the best of us. üòâ Join one of the Community Talks at the Community Clubhouse and learn what your peers are up to.

My pick: CT1249 | Real-life clean core in SAP Cloud ERP Private: Keep it clean, extend smart

I know‚Ä¶that‚Äôs A LOT to choose from. That‚Äôs why I said‚Ä¶put your thinking caps on. üòâ

Not to make it even more difficult for you, but I would be doing the community a disservice if I did not mention some of our ‚Äúdrop-in activities.‚Äù

Community Clubhouse: This is not only where you‚Äôll find the Community Theater, but also the Developer Garage and Developer and Community Advocates like @RichHeilman, @thomas_jung, @josh_bentley, @qmacro  and more... Stop by the Clubhouse, join a Community Talk, try out a tutorial, chat with SAP Mentors & Champions, meet the Developer Advocates and start building connections that‚Äôll last longer than SAP brand names. üòâ

Demo Stations: Seeing is believing, which is why we have an amazing selection of demos across our 9 different tracks that will leave you with no other choice than to say ‚ÄúYes, I believe.‚Äù

If you are not joining us in Berlin, you‚Äôll still be able to build an agenda for SAP TechEd Virtual! Be sure to leave some time in your busy calendar to get the latest and greatest insights coming to you directly from Berlin. With a curated selection of Strategy Talks, Road Maps and Deep Dives, you‚Äôll be in-the-know from the comfort of your own home or office.

As a special treat, we‚Äôll have some live segments exclusively for you, our virtual audience! I won‚Äôt share any details yet‚Ä¶but if you tune into TechEd Virtual outside of the scheduled sessions, it will be worth your while, I promise.

I haven‚Äôt mentioned the keynotes, opening or closing sessions‚Ä¶ because those are no-brainers. Don‚Äôt worry about adding them to your schedule, we‚Äôve done that for you already. üòâ

Happy scheduling! See you in Berlin or online!

entry.title: Re: No message determination schema entered in settlement...

Configuration under section Message Determination.

entry.title: Tooling Decision for S/4 Transformation - Need input
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Hoping to tap into the collective wisdom of this community. We're just kicking off our S/4 transformation journey, and like many of you have probably experienced, we're navigating the maze of third-party tools.

Our focus right now is on custom code readiness. Our System Integrator has put forward SmartShift as their recommended solution for scanning our ABAP code. They're a known quantity, which is good.

However, I received what was likely a cold email from a company called Civra Research Labs. I checked out their site, and while it doesn't have the polish of a major vendor, I went through the demo of their AI-powered S/4 Readiness Scanner. Honestly, the tool itself looks pretty good and the AI-driven analysis does the job.

Here's the kicker: when comparing the proposed cost from our SI for SmartShift against Civra's pricing, SmartShift seems to be about 25 times more expensive. That's a huge difference.

So, I'm here to ask:

  1. Has anyone actually used tools from Civra Research Labs in a real project? I'm interested in their S/4 readiness, ABAP security scanner, or their Pen Testing Co-Pilot. What was your experience with the tool's quality, the results, and their support?

  2. On the other side, has anyone used SmartShift and felt the premium price was justified by the value delivered?

  3. Is a price difference this large a major red flag for the cheaper tool, or is it just a case of a newer player disrupting the market?

I'm looking for real-world, unbiased opinions to help us make an informed decision.

Appreciate any insights you can share.

(And a polite request: I'm looking for genuine user feedback, so no sales pitches or DMs from vendors, please.)

entry.title: Re: ABAP Custom Code remediation
entry.content:
Great write-up especially the split between ‚ÄúHANAtization‚Äù (statement-level fixes) and the deeper push-down with AMDP/CDS.

In your experience, how do you triage mandatory vs. recommended findings from the FUNCTIONAL_DB ATC variant? We often see a long tail of ‚Äúnice to have‚Äù items‚Äîcurious what governance you use (ATC quality gates, exception registers, or code annotations) so exceptions don‚Äôt become permanent.

You also called out areas not covered by static checks (e.g., SmartForms/SAPscript). On HANA migrations I‚Äôve had good mileage combining ATC/SCI with runtime evidence (SQL Monitor/SQLM or ST05) to prioritize hotspots actually executed in production. Do you use a similar runtime-first prioritization?

Re the compatibility views (e.g., BSIS/BSIK) replacing classic index tables in S/4HANA: we‚Äôve found the safest path is to eliminate direct writes and refactor to released APIs/BAPIs or RAP behavior/ CDS-based APIs, and make ORDER BY explicit everywhere legacy code relied on cluster/pool semantics. Has that matched your approach?

Lastly, on the security side of HANAtization: do you flag risky patterns while you‚Äôre there (dynamic Open SQL string concatenation, unchecked ADBC, missing AUTHORITY-CHECK around sensitive ops)? Folding these into the same review has helped us reduce rework later.

Would love to hear how you handle (1) documenting exceptions, and (2) integrating ATC into CI/CD so these issues don‚Äôt regress post-migration.

entry.title: Re: F-27 post on branch instead of head office
entry.content:
F-27 posts against the head office account if the customer master is set up with a head office‚Äìbranch relationship. Even if the SD invoice was posted with the branch as the payer, the system redirects postings to the head office if the branch is flagged with a head office in KNA1 (KNRZE field). Having said that you cannot select the invoice under the branch in F-27. The credit memo posts to the head office, not the branch.

Couple of options / workarounds are there

  • If your client approves to change the configuration to remove the head office assignment. This enables decentralized processing, so F-27 will post directly to the branch. You will be able to select the invoice under the branch account. This affects how payments and dunning are handled, so align with Finance before changing.
  • The next option is post the credit memo via F-27 to Head Office. Then, via F-32, clear the head office credit memo against the branch invoice. This works because SAP aggregates open items across branches under the head office. This is a workaround and it doesn‚Äôt reflect the branch-level devaluation directly but achieves the financial effect.

entry.title: Re: Rebate and Royalties in SAP S/4
entry.content:
Hi @sumit_chourasia1, 

As @MichaelWerner mentioned, Settlement Management can't generate Settlement as SAP SD billing document. 

If you need to include the Rebates amount to deduct it from the business volume value (reduce your base of calculation for Royalties), I would suggest to explore the following options: 

  1. Copy standard configuration for Royalties and make some changes via configuration to add a Condition type in order to impact the Business volume amount (REBV). I would suggest to make a copy of REBD in that case to keep your option open if you want to use the standard condition type REBD in the future. 
    + add the condition type in your pricing procedures. 
    + Maintain a rate (%, Fixed amount, Qty..) for the new condition created which will represent your rebate rate, on top of maintaining your royalty rate. 
    At the time of Settlement, the system will calculate the Business volume + deduct rebate rate from BV + calculate Royalty with correct BV. 
    PROS: no development required and pretty much transparent
    CONS: slightly more complex for the maintenance (if rate changes for rebate then 2 or more contracts should be updated) 

  2.  You should use additional business volume table with 1 CDS view looking at your billing documents + 1 CDS view looking at the specific Settlement document created for your rebate scenario, then a structure to aggregate the data of the 2 CDS views to have the expected BV result. 
    With the above solution, careful with sign and business volume selection. 
    PROS: More automated. 
    CONS: Slightly less transparent to reconcile and analyze + development required + higher effort on the mapping and design + sequential execution of the Settlement is very important and dependent. 

Regards, 
Gauthier Victor

entry.title: Re: How to set up FOC subcontracting process, without bot...
entry.content: @Deepika8 For returnable deliveries in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the standard process utilizes Returnable Transport Packaging (RTP), where packaging is defined as a material, assigned to an outbound delivery with a special item category (NLAG) to track it on customer premises, and billed later if not returned using the Billing Due List (FDSL) app. For non-returnable goods or incidental packaging, the standard outbound delivery process is used, where the packaging is treated as a consumable material and billed immediately with the main product. This entire standard flow is governed by the activated Scope Item 2L6, requires Business Partners flagged as packaging owners, and can be enhanced for tracking using Embedded EWM, providing a fully compliant public cloud solution without custom code.

entry.title: Re: Implementation of paperless process for physical inve...
entry.content: @AdyashaPatra To achieve a paperless physical inventory process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, implement a mobile solution using the standard SAP Mobile Start platform on ruggedized devices. This provides access to the "Manage Physical Inventory Documents" Fiori app for digital counting. To overcome the native app's limited scanning, enhance it with the SAP MobiDoc Barcode Scanner plugin or a partner SDK for robust, industrial-grade barcode scanning that integrates directly with the app. This combination allows counters to scan materials and enter quantities directly on the mobile device, even offline, eliminating paper printouts and manual data entry while ensuring upgrade stability, accuracy, and operational efficiency.

entry.title: Free Joule Base! What does it mean for SAP's resellers?
entry.content:
Over the last months SAP has made several announcements related to making Joule free for customers.  In this article I will review the current status and share my thoughts this topic and the opportunities for SAP channel partners.

My take on SAP making Joule Base free:   There are real costs involved.  When users query Joule SAP leverages LLMs to deal with the quiry and this has costs for SAP.  SAP does not pass this on to users.   But obviously, businesses don‚Äôt give away anything for free without a reason.  In my opinion, SAP has showed commitment to its statement that Joule will be the new UI of SAP solutions.  This is a strategic move for the future.    The core value and ‚Äúcrown jewel‚Äù of SAP is its automation of business processes.  Making it easy and simple for customers to consume these core capabilities will make SAP‚Äôs core solutions more consumed and successful.  And that is where the important revenue streams for SAP are.

Joule is becoming more and more a platform.  Sometimes Joule is even called the AI OS of SAP.  Further, Joule and Joule agents also have the potential to leverage AI to integration all the SAP solutions as needed, on the fly.  Some people say SAP solutions could be better integrated,  perhaps Joule and Joule Agents will be a big step forward in this area?

Joule is becoming so central for SAP offerings and solutions that it makes sense to democratize it. 

What exactly do customers get for free?

Customers get ‚ÄúJoule Base‚Äù for free.  In my opinion, this is pretty much the ‚Äúclassic‚Äù Joule we heard about when SAP launched Joule last year.   Till now, Joule was available for some LOB solutions, but with limitation on how many free ‚ÄúJule requests‚Äù a user was granted. And initially, transactional pattern was not included in the free Joule Base launched at Sapphire this year. However, transactional pattern is now included and there is no limit to the free requests / usage by the user.

With Joule Base users can leverage three types of activities (called Joule patterns): 

  • Navigational: ask a question in your own words related to what you want to do in the system and Joule will analyze your question together with LLMs and propose the best SAP app / screen for you to leverage.   Is these capabilities valuable for a user?  If a user always does the same activities and is an expert in the system, this might have limited value.  But if a user complain that SAP is difficult to work with this can absolutely help.  Also, for new users and existing users needing to do something new in the system the capabilities (together with informational pattern) can be very useful.  Finally, an interesting perspective from a channel partner always positioning Joule to customers and prospects: with the new generation of people joining the workforce, tools like Joule will become more and more important.  The new generation of workers expect to be able to get help from the systems they are supposed to use and master, instead of learning everything upfront.
  • Informational:  user can ask a question about how the SAP system works and Joule will leverage SAP help portal and the LLMs to provide an answer: the relevant sections from the help portal will be collected, passed on to the LLM with the appropriate prompt, and the LLM will make a summary for the specific question of the user.   For example, ‚Äúwhat is the difference between a service order and a service contract‚Äù.   Other examples can be questions about how certain accounting principles works in SAP.   Further, a very interesting opportunity for customers is to extend this capability with information about their own work instructions, policies etc as part of document grounding.  In my opinion, the costing of SAP document grounding is very appealing for smaller customers.
  • Transactional:  While ‚Äúnavigational‚Äù and ‚Äúinformational‚Äù patterns are high level & general information about the SAP solution, transactional action is more about the customer specific business data in the system. Joule can retrieve data about specific business data information.  Example: ‚ÄúShow prices for sales organization 1710 that are due to expire before December 31, 2025‚Äù.   Joule can even change data in the system.  Instead of going to a specific app to do an action, a user can write in their own works instruction for joule to change the data.  For example: ‚ÄúExtend the valid-to dates by one week‚Äù (Joule will know you refer to the previous question about sales prices).   In my opinion, these capabilities can be valuable but are pretty ‚Äúlight‚Äù in terms of AI.  SAP Business AI can also do much more sophisticated & generative transactional actions in the system, but those activities have much higher run costs and is part of Premium AI offerings for which customers must pay extra.

 

Check out more on the AI commercialization on PE Portal

Joule runs on SAP BTP.  To run Joule Base, a customer thus needs to have an SAP BTP account. If a customer does not have an BTP account, they will get the needed entitlements for free.  

What are my opportunities as reseller when Joule base is free? 

If Joule Base is free, there is nothing to resell, right?  So, what is in it for resellers?   The topic is much more strategic than this.  SAP‚Äôs resellers don‚Äôt only ‚Äúsell stuff‚Äù, they also take care of customers to ensure they get the most out of their SAP system, that customers are happy about their SAP system, order more services from the partner and keep renewing their SAP subscriptions (for which partner also get paid).  AI is probably the biggest technology trend at the moment, and I think it is great that channel partners can tell their customers that SAP has invested a lot in R&D to ensure their systems and investment stay up to date with technology.  My recommendation to resellers is to position Joule Base part of what they get for their subscription payments and something which helps protect their investment their SAP system.  

As partner, you can obviously do services around advising and implementing Joule Base for the customer.   And there are a lot of opportunities to do additional AI work for customers on top of Joule Base, including reselling Joule Premium packages and developing customer specific AI capabilities.

What does customers NOT get with Joule Base?

There are basically three categories of capabilities customers don‚Äôt get and must pay extra for if they want to use them:

  • Joule Premium PUPM packages..  There are many deep/niche AI embedded capabilities which is only available in via Joule Premium packages.  Examples are  Financial business insight for ERP Cloud, Performance Goal creation in SuccessFactors and E-mail draft recommender for Service Cloud V2.   These capabilities go much deeper than Joule transactional capabilities and consume significant more LLM capacity.  Thus, these are charged separately.  These functionalities are triggers by users and thus included in the new Per User Per Month (PUPM) packages. 
  • Transactional Capabilities.  Finally, there are some AI powered capabilities not triggered by users, but by ‚Äúthe system‚Äù.  These capabilities are therefore priced based on a transactional metering.  Example of this customer specific document grounding: the upfront indexing of customer specific documents so that they can be leveraged by users (free) via joule base informational pattern later.
  • Analytical Pattern: There is a fourth Joule pattern only available in Joule Premium packages, and that is ‚ÄúAnalytical Pattern‚Äù; the capability for Joule to respond to user prompts about analytical analysis of their SAP data.  Note: customers also need to run SAP Analytic Cloud (SAC) for this to work.  In general, this pattern has been developed by the central Joule team, but most of the LOB product teams still need to make the connection between Joule, LOB solution and SAC. So this pattern is not available yet for most LOB solutions.

What does a customer need to do to get Joule base for free?

While it is free, Joule Base is not automatically available for all customers.  The reason is there are specific AI terms and conditions which SAP wants customers to sign before they get access to Joule.  ‚ÄúOld‚Äù customers don‚Äôt have these T&C in their contract.  The easiest way for customers to get Joule Base is to ‚Äúpurchase ‚ÄùJoule Base on the SAP store (at a cost of 0,00).   This will trigger the signing of the T&Cs and then assignment of the entitlements in the customer‚Äôs system.

Can I as partner also get Joule Base for free for my TDD environment?

Yes.   For ERP Cloud, SuccessFactors, IBP and Digital Manufacturing, get it here for free for your LOB TDD system.  There is no TDD for ERP Cloud Private so there is also no Joule on TDD either.  However, this is planned to change in Q4 2025.  For CX, Joule is not in GA yet but expected to come later this year, also for TDD.

If you are interested in more details, check out more details for each of the SAP LOB solutions:

ERP Cloud

ERP Cloud Private

SuccessFactors

Customer Experience

entry.title: Re: How to configure and perform replenishment strategy i...
entry.content:
Dear Shubham,

Adding to the answer from my colleague Jerry, I¬¥ve also tried to answer your questions. Please check as follows:

1. Am I missing any configuration steps in Public Cloud?

Those are the scope items regarding the Replenishment strategy. The test script of each scope items below is the step-by-step configuration and you can find the links as follows:

Test script - 4B3 : This is the scope item (step by step configuration) of the Replenishment Strategies for In-House Production (4B3), when you produce the kanban quantity yourself, to supply your own production. This is the one Jerry shared in his answer. 

Test script - 1E3 : This scope item 1E3 is regarding Material Replenishment with Kanban ‚Äì External Procurement. Here, you obtain the kanban quantity using an order or a scheduling agreement from a supplier.

Test script - 4B4 : This one is the scope for Material Replenishment with Kanban ‚Äì Stock Transfer, scope item 4B4.It is used when you transfer the kanban quantity to supply your own production.

2. Where I can find below configuration:

- Activate replenishment strategy for a storage type: In this blog from our community you can find instructions about Activate Replenishment Strategy:  SAP Community blog - Replenishment Strategies in SAP S/4Hana Cloud Warehouse Management 
And also you can find more information in the following link: - SAP Help Portal - Production Planning Control - Replenishment Strategies 

- Define replenishment sources: You also can check in the following documentation:  SAP Help Portal - Warehouse Management - Configuration for Replenishment Control 

- How can I Trigger or monitor replenishment in SAP Public Cloud: In the page 275 of the following document, you can find that exists a app called Warehouse Monitor in S/4hana Cloud Public edition: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 - Feature Scope Description 

3. Since I cannot find ‚ÄúActivate Replenishment Strategies in Storage Types‚Äù (which exists in On-Premise), is there an alternative way to achieve this in Public Cloud?
Please check item 2, the first link.

4. Could you share the detailed step-by-step process (with apps to be used) for setting up and testing replenishment in SAP Public Cloud?
Please check the item 1 with tests scripts with step by step instructions.

I hope with all these documents you can clear all your doubts.

Kind regards.
